attributes.title: 2015 Mission Day Message
attributes.description:
In today’s (01st Januarary, 2015, Mission Day) morning Satsang, Paramahamsa Nithyananda returns from Cambodia, blessing everyone on this 12th annual Mission Day. He inaugurates the beginning of the Upanishad series, announcing the focus on Living Advaita. He will not be simply interpreting the Upanishads but actually intercepting the conversations of rishis and sharing the great truths with all of us on. Sitting in the vibrant silence of Upanishad with Dakshinamoorty, we will be lead to the space of Advaita – Shivoham!




TRANSCRIPTS:-

First, my blessings to all of you on this auspicious Mission Day, the day the Sangha flowered.  Understand, twelve years.  We are now twelve-year young organization. We have completed twelve years and we have seen all the seasons – one full ‘maamaangam’, and one full Kumbha Mela period.  
 
First, I wanted to thank everyone who is with us standing, supporting in whatever way they can as a part. Understand, whatever way may be....even if you are a visitor, you mean to us. Not just the volunteers or people who are part of the Sangha, even if you are a visitor, you mean to us. We are here for you. We exist to serve you. Only by you accepting our service we are doing for what we meant to be. So, by accepting our service, you are keeping us alive, you are keeping us living.  So, everyone, whether a visitor or a viewer, or who receives our services, everyone of you mean to us a lot, and I thank everyone of you for keeping us alive. It is for all of you I exist and we exist.  Thank you guys for keeping us alive!
 
Today is also the day, as per the English Calendar, my birthday. We usually celebrate my birthday as per the Vedic tradition, Vedic Calendar.  So, this year it falls on, the ‘Maargazhi’ month Chithra nakshathra falls on January 13th. We will be celebrating on January 13th. But, because it is celebrated as a Brahmotsavam, from today we will be starting all the temple rituals. And temple functions, rituals and processions, we will be starting from today.  
 
On this auspicious day, my blessings to every one of you. From the beginning, knowingly, unknowingly, directly, indirectly, whoever has strengthened us, supported us, stood with us, still standing with us, to everyone of you, I thank, I give my gratitude. I thank you. Some people, even their hit made us very strong! So, everyone who directly, indirectly contributed, I thank every one of you.  
 
Today, the Bidadi Nithyananda Dhyanapeetam is offering 108 naivedhyams to Mahadeva. And all the other temples, cities, are also offering many offerings, naivedhyams.  Above all, the love and the devotion, commitment of all the satsanghis, samajis who supported us by sharing their treasure, talent, time, and made this Sangha as it is now, I thank everyone of you.
 
My message for this whole year: LIVING ADVAITHA.  LIVING ADVAITHA!
 
Everyone will be exploding into Shivoham by living Advaitha.  From today, formally I inaugurate speaking on Upanishads.  From today, formally I inaugurate speaking on the Upanishads. By uttering the first Upanishad mantra, formally I inaugurate the Upanishad series. This expression will be called as ‘Living Advaitha Series’. And, as I already said, I am not going to interpret; I am just going to intercept the conversations of rishis and relay it to you all.  I am not going to be interpreting the conversations of rishis; I am just going to intercept the conversations of rishis.  And, with this mantra, I will inaugurate the Upanishad series.
 
ऊँ पूर्णमदः पूर्णमिदम् पूर्णात् पूर्णमुदच्यते ।
पूर्णस्य पूर्णमादाय पूर्णमेवावशिष्यते ।।
ॐ शान्तिः शान्तिः शान्तिः
 
Om Poornamadhah Poornamidham Poornaath Poornamudhachyathe |
Poornasya Poornamaadhaaya Poornamevaavasishyathey ||
|| Om Shanthi, Shanthi, Shanthihi ||
 
‘Living Advaitha’ means, realizing you are Whole, one with the Whole, you are not a broken or separated, divided part.  Please understand, ‘broken’ means, once for all taken out.  ’Separated’ means, internally divided. ‘Divided’ means, in the internal, sub-division. You are neither broken nor separated or even entered into sub-division from the Whole. The Whole, the Whole exists as Whole. It is not that now you will achieve Completion, and in the future you will experience Complete Completion.
